alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northeastern Nye County; Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Northwestern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 3:38PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Winter weather makes a return Sunday night through Wednesday... The warm and dry weather will end Sunday night and Monday as winter-like conditions return to northern and central Nevada. The snow showers will be around through mid-week. A band of valley rain and mountain snow showers will push into northern Elko and Humboldt counties Sunday afternoon and evening, spreading south and east during the overnight into Monday morning. As the colder air filters in behind the cold front, valley rain should switch over to snow late Sunday night into Monday. Snow showers will continue each afternoon with light amounts expected. For the entire period Monday through Wednesday, valley locations could see up to an inch to possibly three inches, while the mountains are expected to see three to six inches through the entire mid-week period. Winds will also become breezy to windy from the southwest on Monday and especially on Tuesday with northerly winds behind the cold front. Some spots of blowing and drifting snow are possible, especially on higher passes and summits. Temperatures on Monday are expected to be 15 to 20 degrees colder than Sunday, with highs only in the 30s to lower 40s. Motorists should remain alert to rapidly changing weather, and take necessary precautions if travel is necessary. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
